---
title: "`page`"
subtitle: "Create `Page` object"
description: "A handy wrapper around [`Page()`](../structure/Page). Joins `Question` objects into a page."
aliases: 
  - ../page.html
categories:
  - "`velesresearch`"
  - "`velesresearch.tools`"
---

# Modules

`velesresearch`

`velesresearch.tools`

# Usage

::: {#61b9f20f .cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
page(label, *questions, title, description=None, options=None)
```
:::


# Arguments

::: arg_name
label
:::
::: arg_desc
`str`; internal name of the page.
:::

::: arg_name
*questions
:::
::: arg_desc
`list[Question]` or `Question`; list of `Question` objects to appear on the page. Often created with [`questionnaire()`](./questionnaire.qmd).
:::

::: arg_name
title
:::
::: arg_desc
`str`; title of the page. Will be visible in the header.
:::

::: arg_name
description
:::
::: arg_desc
`str`; text just under page header.
:::

::: arg_name
options
:::
::: arg_desc
`PageOptions`; options object created with [`PageOptions()`](../options/PageOptions.qmd), changes behaviour of the page (e.g. random question order).
:::

# Value

A `Page` object.

# See also

- [`questionnaire()`](./questionnaire.qmd) for converting whole questionnaires into a `Questions` list.

- [`PageOptions()`](../options/PageOptions) for available page modifications.

- [`survey()`](./survey.qmd) for composing pages into one survey.

# Examples

::: {#421b555a .cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
from velesresearch import page, question

gender = question(
    "gender",
    "radio",
    "What is your gender?",
    "Woman",
    "Man",
    "Other/I don't want to answer",
)

metric = page("metric", gender)
```
:::
